WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene.synopsis: Branches depending on whether plaeyrs heard about the hammer, took the deal or not and whether voss is waiting in SC.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene.how_to_trigger: After talking to Rapahel in Sharess Caress

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_1.text: Shka'keth! You know Raphael holds the key to the prince's freedom - and you turned away.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_94.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_94.text: We can not let it remain in the devil's possession!

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_3.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_2.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_2.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you refused to bargain with Raphael.*

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_42.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_42.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_112.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_112.text: The means to do so was within our grasp - and you refused it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_5.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_5.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you bargained with Raphael.*

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_96.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_96.text: I'd sooner have imagined shattering a planet with my bare fist than taking a deal with a devil.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_96.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_81.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_81.text: But we shouldn't regret the bargain, not for one instant. Raphael can have his crown, if it means breaking Orpheus free and slicing him open.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_81.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_53.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_53.text: Now we just need to get back into the Astral Prism.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_33.text: The Emperor can't shut us out forever.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_33.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_85.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_85.text: The closer the elder brain, the closer we come to killing Orpheus in his own astral prison.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_85.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_14.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_14.text: Can we trust Raphael? That Orphic Hammer could be worthless.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_35.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_56.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_56.text: Devil's are slippery creatures. They'd twist their tongues into knots to convince you a rockpile was mithril.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_56.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_87.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_87.text: You know that better than anyone, Wyll.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_87.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_62.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_62.text: Ask Wyll. He knows that better than anyone.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_62.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_136.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_136.text: But a broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never have the Crown.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_136.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_44.text: Now, to the Sharess' Caress taproom. I mean to crush the slithering snake we call Voss.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_44.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_90.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_90.text: When the opportunity comes, we'll return to the Prism. Until then, keep the Hammer close.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_22.text: We meet him in the Sharess' Caress taproom, just as he asked -
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_22.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_119.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_119.text: - and we slit his throat before he can utter another word against the Undying Queen.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_119.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_23.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_23.text: Return to Raphael. We must hear him out.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_23.context: NodeContext: SHKAH-keth. (Calling the player an asshole)

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_51.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_51.text: We cannot slay the traitor prince unless we loose him from his astral prison.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_51.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_61.speaker: Narrator
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_61.text: *The tadpole reveals your mind to Lae'zel. She knows you refused to bargain with Raphael.*

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_67.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_67.text: The means to loosing the Prince of the Comet was within our grasp - and you refused it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_30.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_30.text: Because we don't need the deal. We can take the Hammer from the House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_6.text: Chk. I wanted to follow the open valley - the easy way out. You chose the brambled path.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_39.text: First, we slay Voss, the traitor who seeks the end of Queen Vlaakith's glorious reign. Then we find our way to Raphael's House of Hope.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_39.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_126.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_126.text: We'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open on the spot.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_111.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_111.text: First, we slay Voss, the traitor who seeks the end of Queen Vlaakith's glorious reign. Then we return to Raphael's House of Hope.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_111.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_28.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_28.text: We'll find a way into Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_28.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_26.text: Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith!
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_26.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH.

Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_104.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_104.text: We'll return to Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer, smash Orpheus' bonds, and slice him open.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_104.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_37.text: I'm annoyed by it. And I admire you for it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_102.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_102.text: We must speak with Voss. Then we find our way to Raphael's House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_50.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_50.text: We must speak with Voss. Then we return to Raphael's House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_98.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_98.text: We'll take the Orphic Hammer and use it to smash the true heir's bonds.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_98.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_103.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_103.text: Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht - the githyanki will be free.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_103.context:
NodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het

Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_129.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_129.text: We'll find a way into Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer and smash Orpheus' bonds.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_105.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_105.text: We'll return to Raphael's lair. And we'll take the Orphic Hammer and smash Orpheus' bonds.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_76.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_76.text: I don't trust the devil. That Orphic Hammer is probably worthless.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_21.text: Don't be a fool. A broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never take the Crown.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_64.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_64.text: Lucky for us we've another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_46.text: Lucky for us we've another option, glory be to the Comet.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_71.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_71.text: The devil keeps the Orphic Hammer in his lair. If we can find a way in, we can take it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_73.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_73.text: I'll use it to smash the true heir's bonds, and then slice him open on the spot.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_83.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_83.text: First, we kill Voss. Then, we go to the House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_41.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_41.text: Just don't expect a lavish spread awaiting us this time.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_36.text: I'll use it to smash the true heir's bonds. Yisk Gith'ka tavki krash'ht - the githyanki will be free.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_36.context:
NodeContext: YISK GITH-kah TAV-ki KRAHSH-het

Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_128.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_128.text: First, to Voss. Then, to Raphael's House of Hope.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_128.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_114.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_114.text: The devil keeps the Orphic Hammer in his lair. We'll return to the House of Hope and take it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_66.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_66.text: I'm not about to let Raphael become Archdevil Supreme.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_101.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_101.text: Why? Is he any worse than Asmodeus, do you suppose - The Reigning Serpent, he who harvests souls to fight an unwinnable Blood War?

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_15.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_15.text: Worse than Mephistopheles, the devil who slayed his own son, he whose experiments threaten to melt his own frozen throne?

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_60.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_60.text: Bah - your mind is made up. But there's another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_0.text: Bah - your mind is made up. But there's another option, glory be to the Comet.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_0.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_124.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_124.text: I'm questioning it, myself. It's not too late to change my mind, is it?

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_40.text: Not while Raphael's still in Sharess' Caress, it isn't.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_54.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_54.text: Speak with him, plead your case. If you won't, well - there's one more option, all glory to Vlaakith.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_121.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_121.text: Speak with him, plead your case. If you won't, well - there's one more option, glory be to the Comet.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_16.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_16.text: I've made enough devil deals for one lifetime, Lae'zel.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_8.text: Ah, the mighty Blade of Avernus - so kind, so benevolent, until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_27.text: Bah - why should I protest? Your mind is made up. But there's another option, all glory to Vlaakith.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_99.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_99.text: Bah - why should I protest? Your mind is made up. But there's another option, glory be to the Comet.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_100.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_100.text: Ah, Wyll Ravengard, Grand Duke to be - so courageous, so benevolent until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_131.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_131.text: Ah, the heroic Blade of Frontiers - so kind, so benevolent, until it's the githyanki who would suffer.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_69.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_69.text: Voss is waiting. He should know we took the Orphic Hammer.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_74.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_74.text: Raphael must keep the Orphic Hammer in his so-called House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_78.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_78.text: The means to loosing the Prince of the Comet was within our grasp - and you refused it.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_78.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_7.text: But we shouldn't regret the bargain, not for one instant. Raphael can have his crown, if it means breaking Prince Orpheus free.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_7.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_80.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_80.text: Now we just need to get back into the Astral Prism.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_70.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_70.text: The Emperor can't shut us out forever.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_70.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_59.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_59.text: The closer the elder brain, the closer we come to facing Orpheus in his own prison.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_59.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_110.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_110.text: Can we trust Raphael? That Orphic Hammer could be worthless.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_9.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_120.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_120.text: Devils are slippery creatures. They'd twist their tongues into knots to convince you a rockpile was mithril.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_120.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_49.text: You know that better than anyone, Wyll.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_49.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_133.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_133.text: But a broker is as bound by his contract as his buyer. The Hammer must be real, or Raphael could never have the Crown.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_133.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_52.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_52.text: Now, to the Sharess' Caress taproom. We must tell Voss the news.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_52.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_117.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_117.text: When the opportunity comes, we'll return to the Prism. Until then, keep the Hammer close.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_115.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_115.text: Ask Wyll. He knows that better than anyone.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_115.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_72.speaker: Player
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_72.text: Let's hope Orpheus doesn't rip off our heads the moment we free him.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_58.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_58.text: The prince will be suspicious. But he won't be reckless enough to turn on his liberators.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_58.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_4.text: There'd be too little to gain from our deaths, and too much to lose.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_4.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_84.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_84.context: NodeContext: Orpheus path, confident, not vehement

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_88.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_88.text: Shka'keth! You know Raphael holds the key to the prince's freedom - and you turned away.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_88.context: NodeContext: SHKAH-keth. (Calling the player an asshole)

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_77.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_77.text: Either go to Raphael and hear him out, or tell Voss you've failed him and the githyanki people.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_34.text: It will not be a pleasant reunion.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_108.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_108.text: Return to Raphael. We've no other choice.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_91.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_91.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_93.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_93.text: Raphael must keep the Orphic Hammer in his so-called House of Hope.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_95.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_95.text: Now, to find our way in.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_106.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_106.text: Voss is waiting. He should know what happened with Raphael.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_107.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_107.text: Now, we can only wait. We'll slay Orpheus when we next enter the Astral Prism.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_107.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_116.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_116.text: Now, we can only wait. We'll free Orpheus when we next enter the Astral Prism.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_122.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_122.text: Return to Raphael. He holds the key that would unleash the traitor prince.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_55.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_55.text: We can't allow him to keep it.

WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_135.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_135.text: Voss is waiting. It's time we end his misery.
WRD_LaezelAfterRaphaelSoloScene_135.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith path, confident, focused, the very slightest bit vehement.
